title: How to feel about Ariana Grande's new song, God is a Woman - Quora

response.answer_text: I have kind of a mixed feeling about it. I do think Ariana Grande is a great vocalist and obviously she’s very attractive and sexy. BUT what I don’t like is her portrayal of feminism. ‘God is a woman’ is obviously a feminist inspired song, undermining the stereotype of God normally being portrayed as a man. Okay, I do get it and I don’t have any problems with this either. HOWEVER although Ariana Grande likes to portray herself as a feminist, the image she portrays of being a woman is a) wear tons of make-up in order to look as sexually attractive as possibleb) wear bunny or cat ears like models used to do in Playboyc) make cliché sexual poses in video’s What I’m saying is: Ariana Grande on the one hand confirms with the image of a woman being portrayed as a sexual object, on the other hand she complains that women are being portrayed merely as sexual objects to men. If you ask me, this latest song ‘God is a woman’ has a lot to do with clever marketing. Madonna knew nothing sells as good as controversy and provocation and the reason we’re talking about this song here is a sign this strategy works. It has all been done before by Madonna who also created a mixture between feminism, sexuality and religious influences in ‘Like a Prayer’. In a live show she even crucified herself as Christ knowing it would stir up comments. So, although the song in itself is ‘not bad’ I think Ariana Grande gives a very cliché view on feminism. On the one hand, she confirms to the image a woman should look like a supermodel, including oversized fake nails, fake eye-lashes, hair extensions, the typical pin-up, merely a body for a glossy men magazine, on the other hand she complains about women being sexually objectified.
